Location: Sydney, Australia


Engineering Managers reports directly to the Director of Engineering and functions as the leader of a highly capable team of engineers. What You'll Be Doing

  • Running the day-to-day management of the Engineering organisation with an emphasis on results, recruiting, and helping to mentor and develop software engineers

  • Setting, evangelising, and enforcing our processes – both within the team and to the organisation at large

  • In collaboration with the engineering team, setting the vision for the technology and architecture, including any shifts needed to stay current over the next decade

  • Developing and delivering the technology roadmap and executing the product roadmap in collaboration with the engineering team

  • Provide on-site coaching and problem solving to engineers across disciplines including mobile clients (iOS & Android), Server (Node, Ruby, C#), and infrastructure operations/devops.

  • Manage the infrastructure budget, understand resources available and utilize them effectively to support the department


Who We Are Looking For

  • 3+ years track record of successfully managing, recruiting, developing, & scaling world class engineering teams of 5+ people

  • Demonstrated experience driving engineering efforts in a startup environment and providing hands-on management

  • Experience with services oriented architecture, testing methodologies, and a zeal for automation at all levels

  • Compelling communicator with both tech & non-tech audiences, who inspires & motivates

Software Assurance Lead

Company Name Thales Company Location Melbourne, AU

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 11 views

Job description

Why Work For Thales?

At Thales, we’re committed to caring about the whole of you. Creating an environment of trust and empowerment where your contribution is valued, where your well-being counts and you can manage the right work-life balance for you. We believe that embracing flexibility is a smarter way of working. We’re always open to discussing your individual needs, just let us know what works for you.

That commitment extends through our generous benefits package: that’s why Thales were the first Engineering company in Australia to pay the superannuation guarantee on unpaid primary carer’s leave. Whether you want to work for 4 years and get paid to take the 5th year off, or you just need help finding a childcare place, you’ll have our support every step of the way.

Developing Your Career

We’re committed to giving you opportunities to be your best. We believe in embracing the passion and potential of our people, and to achieve this we offer market leading training, development and experiences, along with the opportunity to be mentored and coached by some of the smartest minds in the industry. We hire from within as our first priority, so you’ll have a myriad of opportunities within our diverse, global organisation.

About Thales

We’re inventing the future, right here, right now, at Thales. We design the critical security solutions of tomorrow by combining the curiosity to explore, the intelligence to question and the vision to create. Together we clarify complicated problems by combining our experience in market with our leading research and development capabilities.

Our Opportunity

OneSKY is a game-changer for Australia’s airspace. The project will unify Australian skies under a new, harmonised air traffic management system. This will enable a new level of safety and efficiency, while also reducing delays for the travelling public and providing opportunities to improve environmental outcomes. It will be the catalyst for better connectivity to underpin Australia’s sustainable growth into the future. OneSKY will transform Australia’ sky and we are proud to be partners in its delivery.

We are now looking for a Software Assurance Lead to play a key role in supporting the Program to achieve the software certification of the core Air Traffic Management system against the DO-278A standard.

Main Responsibilities
  • Establish and deploy processes and tools related to the production of software artefacts to satisfy the Software Assurance requirements
  • Define and produce training kits as well as managing the acquisition plan for software assurance skills
  • Produce detailed description of activities to attain the software certification including Software Data Package, test evidence/tools and qualimetric data
  • Execute de defined Configuration Management strategy for maintaining the Software Assurance artefacts
  • Assess efficiency of new processes through interviews/surveys and measure impacts on cost model

About You
  • Engineering degree in Computer Science or equivalent
  • Experience greater than 5 years in software development of real time and distributed systems in Rail, Traffic, Marine, Aviation or any safety real time systems area.
  • Track record in development and/or deployment of tooling and processes supporting software development
  • Knowledge in System and Software Engineering tools as well as the System and Software Engineering life-cycle
  • Understanding and application of DO-278A, DO-178B/C, ED-153 or similar standards

Special Requirement

All candidates must be eligible for an Australian Defence Security Clearance. The suitable candidate may need to be ITARS cleared

  • Aviation & Aerospace
  • Defense & Space

Full-time

  • Information Technology

Company Name Department of Justice and Regulation, Victoria, Australia Company Location Melbourne, AU

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 13 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

At the Department of Justice and Regulation, we’re looking for people who want to make a difference. People who take pride in their work. People who get things done. People who are committed to making Victoria a safer place.

We embrace diversity and strive to have a workforce that reflects the community we serve. We’re all about recruiting the best people, regardless of gender, age, disability, religion, sexual orientation or cultural background. If you think you can do the job and would be a good fit for our department, we’d love to hear from you.

The department is committed to the safety and wellbeing of children and recognises that children’s rights need to be respected, their views welcomed and valued, and their concerns taken seriously and acted upon.

If you’re having any trouble viewing this ad and would like it or any attachments in an accessible format (such as large print), please don’t hesitate to get in touch with the contact person listed on the ad.

For more information on working with us and our recruitment process, please visit justice.vic.gov.au/careers

We’re proud of the important work we do across Victoria. Want to be part of it?

  • Utilise your organisational change management leadership skills
  • Opportunity to work with senior stakeholders across Corrections Victoria to influence change
  • Senior VPS 6 role ($116,863 - $156,387 + super)
  • 12 months fixed term, Carlton location

An exciting 12 months fixed term opportunity exists for an Organisational Change Manager in Corrections Victoria Information Technology, Department of Justice and Regulation.

Corrections Victoria (CV) is responsible for the direction, management and operation of Victoria's corrections system, which incorporates prisons and Community Correctional Services (CCS). As a service agency within the Department of Justice & Regulation, CV develops and implements policies, programs and services that ensure the safe and secure containment of prisoners, and that seek to rehabilitate offenders by addressing the underlying causes of offending behaviour.

Corrections Victoria Information Technology (CVIT) is a business unit within Corrections Victoria (CV) that is responsible for implementing, maintaining and supporting business applications and technology that is essential to the day-to-day operations of CV. CVIT is responsible for the development and delivery of high quality Information Communication & Technology (ICT) support, services, advice and project management to enable the successful implementation and running of CV's business objectives.

The Organisational Change Manager will play a key role in ensuring projects (change initiatives) meet objectives on time and on budget by increasing employee adoption and usage. This role will focus on the people side of change – including changes to business processes, systems and technology, job roles and organisation structures.

As our ideal candidate, you will be required to demonstrate:

  • significate experience in leading organisational change management for ICT projects, including development and implementation of organisational change management strategies
  • an in-depth understanding of the drivers of organisational priorities and service delivery within a complex ICT environment
  • the ability to build and maintain trusting and credible relationships with stakeholders

For more information on the accountabilities and key selection criteria for the role please refer to the position description attached

Applications for this role close midnight Wednesday 10 October 2018

886383849:
[

Associate

Company Name Department of Premier and Cabinet (NSW) Company Location Sydney

New Posted Date Posted 6 hours ago Number of views 13 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

  • Do you have economic policy experience, an understanding of Cabinet processes, and looking to expand your skills in a central agency environment?
  • Do you have strong analytical and engagement skills, and looking to work in a fast-paced environment addressing diverse and complex economic policy issues?


The NSW Department of Premier and Cabinet (DPC) is the lead central agency in the NSW Government. Our mission is to enhance the lives of the people of NSW by driving priorities, brokering outcomes and delivering programs and services.


We support the Premier and Deputy Premier, the Cabinet, Ministers and agencies by coordinating policies and services across government. We lead policy development, provide innovative ideas and support Government plans and projects.


Working with us will give you a broad overview in areas such as public policy formulation, public administration and state administrative matters and an opportunity to be involved in a range of state-wide policies, issues and projects.


For more information go to http://www.dpc.nsw.gov.au/about/about_the_department.


About the Role


The Associate, Economic Policy provides well researched and sound advice on which the Department can rely for effective decision making. This role will report to the Economic Policy Associate Director (Treasury) and be responsible for:


  • Reviewing Cabinet and ERC proposals, project submissions or proposed initiatives, including consultation with relevant stakeholders, to develop recommendations in relation to the soundness and feasibility of proposals, submissions or initiatives.
  • Preparing advice on Treasury policy issues, and undertaking consultations to develop proposals and approaches and prepare advice for the Director.
  • Liaising and consulting with senior officers across the public sector and with external stakeholders to ensure engagement and effective interface on policy, project or program development.
  • Developing, reviewing and editing draft responses to departmental and ministerial correspondence and briefings ensuring key issues are addressed, the information is factual, accurate and succinct, and the NSW policy position is properly represented.
  • Working as an integral team member including supporting team members, fostering effective communication, information exchange and cooperative work arrangements across the Branch, Group and DPC.


A bit about you


  • Strong economic, financial, data and presentation skills. Experience working in top-tier consulting firms or Commonwealth or State Treasuries (or similar experience with involvement in the preparation or analysis of government budgets) will be highly regarded.
  • Agility to work comfortably in a fast-paced environment, dealing with multiple stakeholders and complex issues.
  • Strong communication and engagement skills, and good team player.
  • Experience in undertaking all aspects of the policy process – research, development, review and evaluation.
  • Appropriate tertiary qualifications or equivalent relevant professional experience.



How to Apply: Your application should include:


  1. a cover letter (maximum two pages) addressing the two targeted questions below.
  2. an up-to-date resume of no more than five pages which clearly details your relevant skills and experience.


Target Questions:

  1. Describe an example of a project where you demonstrated highly developed verbal and written communication skills to deal with diverse stakeholders.
  2. Provide an example from your recent work experience where you prepared advice in response to an urgent issue that needed to be turned around in a short time frame.


Learn more: Please review the Role Description. For enquiries regarding this role, please contact Kar Mei Tang on (02) 9228 3983, or email KarMei.Tang@dpc.nsw.gov.au.


Closing date: Sunday, 7 October 2018 (11:59 PM)


Job note: A recruitment pool may be established to fill similar temporary or ongoing vacancies in the next 12 months.


Salary: Clerk Grade 7/8. Package includes base salary ($94,782.00 - $104,918.00) plus superannuation and leave loading.


Help: Should you encounter any technical problems, please contact the I work for NSW helpdesk on 1800 562 679


Our Commitment to Flexibility: At DPC we endeavour to make roles flexible. While this role is advertised as full time, we will consider requests to undertake the work on a flexible part-time or job share basis.


Our Commitment to Diversity: DPC is a White Ribbon accredited organisation and is committed to ensuring the sector reflects the NSW community it serves. Diverse workforces are more innovative, productive and increase the delivery of high-quality services. We welcome and encourage applications from diverse backgrounds, including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people, LGBTI+, people with disability, other diversity groups, and women.

Seniority Level

Associate

Industry

  • Government Administration

Employment Type

Full-time

Job description

About GFG Alliance

GFG Alliance has an agile, entrepreneurial culture with high energy, strong levels of ambition, and sustainable growth plans. This brings opportunities for GFG’s people and businesses to flourish and develop. We work with our people to determine how we can grow our business and our future. We are committed to uncompromising levels of safety, strong customer centricity and diversity. Wherever they are in the world, our people are our greatest asset. We welcome you to join us.

About The Role

The Australian Reinforcing Company (ARC) is a leading manufacturer and supplier of steel reinforcing products to the Australian construction industry. For 98 years, our people have worked tirelessly to understand and fulfil the needs of a diverse national customer base. We partner with the industry to drive innovation and maximise returns, whilst building deep and enduring relationships at every opportunity. Rapidly approaching our 100 th year of operation, we have a clear plan for future growth and are looking for the right people to be part of our journey.

As a member of the GFG Alliance, ARC benefits from being part of an agile, entrepreneurial culture, with high energy, strong levels of ambition, and sustainable growth plans. This brings opportunities for GFG’s people and businesses to flourish and develop. We work with our people to determine how we can grow our business and our future together and are committed to uncompromising levels of safety, strong customer centricity and diversity. Wherever they are in the world, our people are our greatest asset.

About The Role

As a preferred supplier to Tier 1 & 2 Construction companies, ARC has contributed to the successful delivery of some of the most iconic structures and essential infrastructure projects across Australia. We are now seeking a dynamic and experienced Sales Manager to build and lead a highly effective, segment-focused sales force who win work based on superior market insights, exceptional understanding of customer/project needs and tailored value propositions.

Reporting to the National Sales Manager, your main area of focus, outside of team leadership, is to manage major customers and ensure the delivery of outstanding segment specific value propositions, ensuring that the project pipeline is managed effectively at all times.

Accountabilities and Success Factors
  • Implement State and National Segment Plan including business strategies, plans, drivers and initiatives
  • Overseeing the delivery of the sales budget, you will lead, coach and develop a dedicated team of Sales Executives to deliver on their Segment sales targets
  • Strategic development of one of ARC’s core national market segments
  • Ensure the success of sustainable long-term relationships with customers
  • Drive new product development and innovation through participation in special projects
  • Involvement in key negotiations with major accounts
  • Provide weekly reporting and communication on field execution and communicate successes issues and opportunities
  • Ensure collaborative, transparent and honest communication to internal and external stakeholders regarding key activities


Skills & Qualifications
  • Minimum of 5 years demonstrated and relevant work experience in manufacturing, sales or engineering
  • A great sales coach with the ability to motivate and get the best from people working for you
  • A great listener who can turn knowledge into value
  • Process and detail oriented and able to drive these behaviours through your team
  • Ability to engage other stakeholders to achieve sales & business objectives

What's in it for you?
  • Career advancement opportunities across a national and international business
  • A genuine, open and high performing culture
  • Competitive remuneration package including 14% superannuation

Click APPLY to submit your application. #LI

Why work for GFG Alliance?

Across our different business units, we offer career opportunities for people who share our drive, passion and ambition. From apprentices and graduates to experienced professionals, we are committed to offering fulfilling careers and the chance to grow as our business grows. We would love you to be part of our journey.

Job description

**The company**
Our client, OneVue, is the largest Managed Funds administrator in Australia with over $500bn in FAU. A fast-growing, award-winning, ASX-listed financial services company making its mark in online investment management and administration solutions for the intermediated, self-managed super fund, superannuation administration, portfolio services, and unit registry sectors across Australia.
With offices in Sydney, Melbourne, Albury and Hobart, offer a wealth of retail and wholesale services to an impressive client list spanning everything from global Custodians, Fund Managers, Financial Advice groups to individual investors.
OneVue is currently referred to as the ‘next big player’ in the financial services industry. Because of recent acquisitions and high-profile Fund transitions, some great opportunities are available for anyone serious about a career in the financial services company of the future.
**The role**
This role presents a great opportunity for an experienced operational control professional to be involved in a wide range of control framework activities within the OneVue Group. Key primary objectives of the role are to implement Control Self-Assessment (CSA) program, Control Independent Assurance, Incident Management and Key controls management initiatives.
We don’t need to go into a long list of tasks and responsibilities here - if you are the right person for the job, you’ll know what needs to be done.

Essentially, You Will Be Accountable For These Outcomes
  • Develop, implement and embed a control self-assessment program for all key processes
  • Identify, assess, monitor, measure and manage key controls
  • Identify root cause, source and analyse appropriate data to support and influence effective controls management;
  • Drive and facilitate incident management including the independent assessment of the preventative, detective rectification and remediation actions;
  • Monitor the effectiveness, proactive implementation and completion of all audit and monitoring programs of work;
  • Develop and implement strategies for improving the control environment;
  • Track and proactively report to management on insightful thematics from the controls testing and monitoring activities;
  • Continuously improve risk and control management processes to drive efficiency and increase effort on high value tasks;
  • Apply cross-Group and external/industry perspective to provide insights into potential control failure impacts; and
  • Provide support to the Senior Manager Risk & Compliance and Head of Group AML.
**About You**

Skills

Apart from the usual well-developed interpersonal skills and ability to work under pressure expected in a key management role, you’ll be able to demonstrate

It is likely you are already in a similar role or ready to make the next step up and just need the opportunity.
  • 3+ years of audit, risk or operational controls experience (essential).
  • Strong background and knowledge in the financial services industry, with an understanding of the wealth management and operational environment.
  • Ability to apply control self-assessment and incident management operational business environments.
  • Relevant industry/tertiary qualifications (desirable)
  • Highly developed interpersonal and people management skills, including ability to interact with and influence people at all levels, including senior management
  • Excellent problem solving and analytical skills.
  • Excellent organisational and time management skills, including prioritisation.
  • Continuous improvement advocate.
  • Technology skills, including Microsoft Office suite (intermediate).
  • High level of accuracy and attention to detail.
  • Tenacity and resilience, able to remain calm under pressure.
**What’s in it for you**
A competitive salary is on offer, along with a genuine career opportunity working with passionate, intelligent high-achievers in a company that is going places fast.

Unique opportunity for a Senior Project Manager with construction projects experience to progress to business leadership.

  • Company established for 30 years and embarking on new stage of growth
  • High quality and beautiful bespoke structural metal work
  • Work/life balance with 38 hour week - 5 mins from a station

My client has established themselves as leaders in the design, fabrication and installation of structural and architectural metalwork and glass. They partner with top tier clients to develop bespoke engineered designs and have worked on some of Sydney's most iconic buildings and construction projects.

  • Work from home.
  • Work from satellite offices.
  • Hot desk from other disciplines.
  • Experiment with new or different approaches.
  • International secondments encouraged.

\xa0

Their flexibility stems from being results focused. If the outcome is being accomplished, they don’t sweat the details on the journey to get there. Employees have thrived in this environment.

\xa0

In addition to the flexibility they encourage, they provide incredible career support that includes tracking your current career, working with you to define your goals and then creating individualised plans to help you get there. This is reviewed biannually, plotted through a unique digital platform and fully supported by training managers and divisional leaders.


Salary on offer is flexible on experience but currently indicated at $150,000+

\xa0

884934413:
[

Research Manager

Company Name YouGov Galaxy Company Location Sydney, Australia

New Posted Date Posted 1 hour ago Number of views 3 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Are you our new Research Manager in the\xa0Research Team?

\xa0

This is an exciting role based in YouGov’s Australian office, to work on projects for some exciting blue-chip clients in the region.

\xa0

We aim to explore what people in Australia think and feel and, as far as possible, why they think and feel as they do.

\xa0

You will be involved in all aspects of the research cycle, including identifying research objectives, designing and managing research projects, analysing results and communicating findings. Ideally, you will need to have your ear to the ground as to what’s going on in Australia and make recommendations on topics and give insights into what the data means.

\xa0

This is a key role in the team and you will be working closely with clients to ensure their needs are met.\xa0

\xa0

What will I be doing?

\xa0

You will have the chance to work closely with a range of clients, developing and managing accounts and running complex projects. As well as research, you’ll proactively work on developing business, as well as contributing ideas to, and leading on, the team’s product innovations. Your commercial awareness and excellent communication skills will allow you to use your research skills to really promote YouGov’s research offering.\xa0

\xa0

Day-to-day you will be leading on sample design, questionnaire design and management, data analysis, presentations, proposal writing along with client liaison. You’ll manage exciting projects and be comfortable with costings and financial management. As a research expert for your clients, you will also share your knowledge with your direct reports to support their growth and development.

\xa0

\xa0

What do I need to bring with me?

\xa0

As you’d expect, you will already be an experienced Senior Researcher working on fast turnaround projects (and plenty of them). You’ll have experience of designing and running research projects; including sampling, questionnaire set-up, delivery and analysis. Line management or mentoring experience would also really help you in this role, along with excellent written English language skills and being extremely personable and client facing is crucial.

\xa0

\xa0

A couple more things . . .

\xa0

This is a full time role, based at our Chatswood Office, Sydney.\xa0\xa0

\xa0

P.S. If you’ve read this and realised that the role isn’t for you, could you recommend someone you know?

Job description

  • Dynamic, market leading firm
  • Unique blend of private practice and General Counsel
  • Attractive salary package


This is a rare and unique opportunity to join a dynamic and successful organisation, in a role that combines management of an ‘in house’ law firm and general counsel. Backed by a well established private equity firm, this organisation has seen significant growth over the last 4 years. They are a market leader in this relatively new and ‘disruptive’ sector, and well placed to continue their expansion.

Reporting to the COO, and a key member of the senior leadership team, core responsibilities will include:

  • Day to day management of a niche law firm offering an array of legal advice in relation to motor vehicle accident management.
  • Including human resources, work flow, compliance and financial management.
  • Handling escalated and complex cases.
  • Provide legal advice and general counsel to the broader group.
  • Manage state/ federal regulatory requirements.
  • Coordinate work of internal and external legal staff.
  • Contribute to the broader groups, development and implementation of business strategies and growth.

\xa0

They are seeking interest from Lawyers, with at least 5 years PQE, and a background in Insurance, Personal Injury/ Motor Vehicle Claims, or credit hire/ demurrage law. You be a collaborative team player, with a hands on management style, and the ability to provide valuable input into the broader companies strategies and development plans.

\xa0

For more information, please contact Andrew Macleanan on 02 8123 1140, click Apply, or email your resume to am@successionrecruitment.com.au
